title: Do websites have the information of people downloading information like an image or taking a screenshot? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not really. How website works is very simple. You, the user request the website, which is simply a collection of a few files, mainly HTML, CSS, JS, Images etc… By visiting these websites, you are downloading these files into your computer. Hence, there is much of a distinction between downloading it and visiting it. Although, complicated event tracking can be used to track downloads of media files, if required. But, no one really cares about it. Third, the so called information is only limited to common analytics data like geography, browser type, IP etc… Nothing concerning the users actual identity. Thanks for the Q&A. Find me at jyothisjoy.com
